byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31--A world that faces 1940 torn between hope of an early peace and fear of an intensifying of war was pictured by Secretary of State Cordell Hull today in a statement voicing his views on the outlook for the coming year which he ...

headline.main: HULL VOICES HOPE FOR PEACE IN 1940; Clings to the Possibility That Conscience or Reason May Rule Before War Spreads AGGRESSION HELD BARRIER Strong Nations Must Refrain From Imposing Upon Weak, He Says--U.S. Stand Lauded

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31--A world that faces 1940 torn between hope of an early peace and fear of an intensifying of war was pictured by Secretary of State Cordell Hull today in a statement voicing his views on the outlook for the coming year which he said he was making in response to numerous requests.
